intro: Globulariopsis tephrodes, commonly known as the desert globularia, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and is often found growing in rocky soils or gravelly areas. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a subtle ornamental value to its harsh environment. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in drought conditions, making it well adapted to desert climates. This species is also valued for its low maintenance and ability to thrive in xeriscaped gardens.
